intro: Cardamine cheotaiyienii, commonly known as the Cheotaiyien mountain buttercup, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, usually yellow or white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. It has small, trifoliate leaves and produces numerous tiny flowers arranged in a single cluster. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
